score_details.score_summary: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) earns 73/100 due to exceptional alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Anera holds a 100.0/100 score and maintains a 96.3% program expense ratio and $0.01 fundraising efficiency.
Anera is zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
Total revenue for the period was $173,279,297.
The organization distributes cash grants for development and in-kind medical contributions.
Anera provides various giving methods for donors to support Middle East relief.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial transparency rating and high program efficiency, though its impact score is moderated by high operational costs per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively low working capital of 1.2 months, which may limit long-term financial flexibility during lean periods.
High cost per beneficiary relative to some peer humanitarian organizations.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors through its dedicated zakat program and long track record of humanitarian service in high-urgency regions [2][14]. Its mission to support refugees with dignity and purpose has remained consistent since its founding in 1968 [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: Anera demonstrates high operational efficiency with a 96.3% program expense ratio and a total revenue of $173,279,297 [1][3]. While the organization provides direct provision of medical supplies and development grants, the cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately $17,588, and it holds 1.2 months of working capital [1][8].

baseline_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees and vulnerable communities across the Middle East.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 96.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised.
Perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100 for accountability and financial health.
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1968, Anera is a non-political and non-religious organization dedicated to helping those affected by conflict in the Middle East live with dignity through education, health, and economic development programs [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to distribute funds to those in need according to established asnaf categories [2].

all_citations.quote: Anera helps refugees and others hurt by conflicts in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and Jordan.

all_citations.claim: agriculture, education, health, and emergency response
all_citations.quote: Our programs: Health, Education, Agriculture, Water & Sanitation, Emergency Relief.
Anera is Zakat-eligible. 96.3% of your Zakat goes to those in need.
Most efficient charities spend at least 75% on programs.
Total expenditures for grants to foreign organizations: $38,290,573

all_citations.claim: in-kind medical supplies and humanitarian aid
all_citations.quote: In-kind contributions consist primarily of medical supplies.

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial transparency rating and high program efficiency, though its impact score is moderated by high operational costs per beneficiary.

areas_for_improvement.context: Anera maintains <cite id="13">1.2 months of working capital</cite> in reserve; while healthy, increasing this would provide more stability during <cite id="14">lean funding periods</cite>.
The calculated <cite id="14">cost per beneficiary of $17,588.26</cite> is high for the humanitarian sector, suggesting a need for more granular impact reporting.

bbb_assessment.summary: Anera maintains high governance standards with a <cite id="1">96.3% independent board</cite> and audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The high cost per beneficiary is likely skewed by large-scale infrastructure and medical equipment projects rather than simple aid distribution.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Working capital of 1.2 months</cite> is on the lower end of the optimal range
<cite id="14">High cost per beneficiary ($17,588.26)</cite> compared to peers
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">financial liquidity</cite> and the <cite id="14">high cost per beneficiary</cite>.

data_gaps: Detailed breakdown of cost-per-beneficiary by program type
confidence.notes: Extremely high financial transparency and consistent reporting.

known_gaps: High cost-per-beneficiary requires more detailed program-level breakdown

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors due to <cite id="7">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="2">underserved populations in Palestine and Lebanon</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Anera is highly credible, holding a <cite id="15">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="1">100/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their <cite id="1">board is 96.3% independent</cite>, ensuring strong oversight.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already near-perfect; maintaining the <cite id="15">Platinum Candid status</cite> remains the gold standard for transparency.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="10">$38.2 million in direct grants</cite> to foreign recipients. They <cite id="15">track 3 specific outcome metrics</cite> via Candid.
impact.improvement: Impact scores could improve by <cite id="14">building working capital reserves</cite> to 1-1.2 months of working capital to ensure long-term sustainability.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcome tracking through Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes in-kind medical supplies and cash grants to local partners and clinics.

rich_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees and vulnerable communities across the Middle East.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support large-scale humanitarian relief in the Middle East through a highly efficient, zakat-eligible institution with a 50-year track record.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations for Palestinian and Lebanese refugees
Prioritize organizations with a 96.3% program expense ratio
Value long-term institutional stability in conflict zones
giving_considerations: Large-scale operations mean donations support broad regional programs
High reliance on in-kind contributions for financial efficiency
Focus is on Middle Eastern refugee populations specifically
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking small-scale, local US community projects or those requiring RCT-level evidence for every dollar spent.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that the organization <cite id="15">tracks outcome metrics</cite> and provides strategic goals, but lacks independent RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Anera uses a multi-sectoral approach (Health, Education, Agriculture) to move refugees from emergency relief to sustainable dignity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale distributions of medical supplies actually improve health outcomes for refugees.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="12">24.1% revenue growth rate</cite> and ongoing crises in Gaza and Lebanon, Anera has high capacity to absorb new funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Anera's <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> significantly outperforms the <cite id="9">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and size
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Intergovernmental status vs Anera's NGO flexibility
similar_organizations.name: UNRWA

strengths.detail: Anera directs <cite id="4">96.3% of its expenses to programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
The organization maintains a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, with perfect marks in <cite id="1">Accountability, Culture, and Leadership</cite>.
Anera spends only <cite id="5">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite>, allowing for massive scale in its <cite id="10">$38.2 million in foreign grantmaking</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Anera's operational model is built on high-volume distribution of essential goods. In 2023, the organization managed <cite id="3">$173,128,388 in total contributions</cite>, a substantial portion of which includes <cite id="11">in-kind medical supplies and humanitarian aid</cite>. This model allows Anera to maintain a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that donor capital is not eroded by administrative costs. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated robust growth with a <cite id="12">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.1%</cite>, indicating increasing trust and capacity to absorb funding for critical Middle Eastern crises.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1968</cite>, American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) is a leading humanitarian organization providing relief and long-term development to refugees and vulnerable communities in <cite id="2">Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan</cite>. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="3">$173,279,297 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Anera is distinguished by its exceptional financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 96.3%</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="5">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. This ensures that nearly every dollar donated is directed toward its core sectors of <cite id="6">agriculture, education, health, and emergency response</cite>. The organization holds a <cite id="1">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting top-tier accountability and transparency. As a <cite id="7">zakat-eligible charity</cite>, Anera provides a verified pathway for Muslim donors to support <cite id="7">fuqara (the poor) and masakin (the needy)</cite> in high-conflict zones. Its long history of over <cite id="8">55 years of operation</cite> has established it as a stable institution capable of navigating the complex logistical challenges of the Middle East.
